cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 225 miles east of Caibarien, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving along the north-coast of Cuba, then turning northwest toward the Florida Keys and the southern Florida Peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Jupiter Inlet to the Flagler/Volusia County Line; North of Bonita Beach to Anclote River; Cuban provinces of Guantanamo, Holguin, Las Tunas and Matanzas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee, Florida Bay, the southeastern, central and northwestern Bahamas, and the north-coast Cuban provinces of Camaguey, Ciego de Avila, Sancti Spiritus and Villa Clara
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern coast of Cuba, the Bahamas, Florida Keys and much of the Florida peninsula, with effects spreading northward along the southeast U.S. coast
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not available for St. Croix in advisory #38 table
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force wind gusts impacted St. Croix on 6 September and have since moved away.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Coastal inundation of 3–5 ft was possible in low-lying areas when Irma passed.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain totals of 4–8 inches were possible when the core passed on 6 September.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents in surrounding coastal waters
